summary.para: Preserve source identity values. Identity columns can be kept only if they are not defined as GENERATED ALWAYS. If they are defined as GENERATED ALWAYS, the WriteToServer method throws an exception.
When not specified, identity values are assigned by the destination.
Assign a table lock for the duration of the data load operation. Other applications are not permitted to update the table during the data load operation.
When not specified, table reads are allowed on the table for rows that existed before the copy operation.

member.name: T:Devart.Data.DB2.DB2Types.DB2RoundingMode
member.summary: Specifies the rounding mode to use when creating a structure from a string using the method.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.DB2.DB2Types.DB2RoundingMode.Ceiling
member.summary: Round toward positive infinity. If all of the discarded digits are zero or if the sign is negative, the result is unchanged. Otherwise, the result coefficient should be incremented by 1 (rounded up).

member.name: F:Devart.Data.DB2.DB2Types.DB2RoundingMode.Down
member.summary: Round toward 0 (truncation). The discarded digits are ignored.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.DB2.DB2Types.DB2RoundingMode.Floor
member.summary: Round toward negative infinity. If all of the discarded digits are zero or if the sign is positive, the result is unchanged. Otherwise, the sign is negative and the result coefficient should be incremented by 1 (rounded up).

member.name: F:Devart.Data.DB2.DB2Types.DB2RoundingMode.HalfEven
member.summary: Round to nearest; if equidistant, round down. If the discarded digits represent greater than half (0.5) of the value of a one in the next left position, then the result coefficient should be incremented by 1 (rounded up). Otherwise (if the discarded digits are 0.5 or less), the discarded digits are ignored.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.DB2.DB2Types.DB2RoundingMode.HalfUp
member.summary: Round to nearest; if equidistant, round up. If the discarded digits represent greater than or equal to half (0.5) of the value of a one in the next left position then the result coefficient should be incremented by 1 (rounded up). Otherwise, the discarded digits are ignored.
